thread.title: NSW residents score themselves better power deals
thread.title_full: NSW residents score themselves better power deals

author: Sophie Elsworth MoneysaverHQ deputy editor
title: NSW residents score themselves better power deals
text:
THOUSANDS of disgruntled NSW energy customers fed up with soaring power prices have taken action this week to get themselves a better deal.
One of the nation’s largest energy retailers — Energy Australia — has rolled out an offer to give customers cheaper utility costs and leave them with savings of up to $600 per year.
The Big Energy Switch — a joint initiative between News Corp Australia and One Big Switch — has seen more than 21,400 households sign up to the campaign including an additional 2500 households since Monday, signalling that consumers are sick of being ripped off with high utility costs. Participating in a case study for One Big Switch ... Scott and Jacqi Willis with son Ben Cavanagh, 16 in their Castle Hill Home. Picture: Jonathan Ng Source: News Corp Australia
One Big Switch spokesman Joel Gibson said savvy customers are not only signing up to the deal to receive the savings, but they are also using it to bargain for better prices from their current utility provider.
“We’re just one day into a four-week offer period but already the data suggests that over 1000 people have saved — either by switching or by using the offer to shop around and negotiate,’’ he said.
“It’s a really aggressive offer from one of the biggest energy retailers in the market and people are responding, finally they are getting some relief.”
Discounts of up to 22 per cent off Energy Australia’s market electricity costs and 16 per cent off their gas usage costs could see NSW households end up with hundreds of dollars extra in their pockets a year.
The offer is available to both existing Energy Australia customers and new customers.
Castle Hill couple Scott and Jacqui Willis said they had been receiving exorbitant power bills which prompted them to join the campaign to try and save money.
“I signed up because our power bills had literally doubled,’’ Mr Willis said.
“I’m sick of the high prices.”
One Big Switch, News Corp and Seven West Media will earn a commission from any accepted offers.
To join the campaign visit: onebigswitch.com .
